concept_data.title: President of the European Parliament
concept_data.category_name: EU institutions and European civil service
concept_data.category_full: 1006 EU institutions and European civil service

summary: The "President of the European Parliament" (EP) is a pivotal figure within the EU institutions, serving as the presiding officer of the Parliament. This role entails overseeing legislative procedures, ensuring adherence to parliamentary rules, and representing the EP in external relations. The President is elected by Members of the European Parliament (MEPs) and plays a crucial role in facilitating dialogue among various EU bodies. As a redirect to the preferred term "President of the EP," this concept underscores the importance of leadership within the EU's democratic framework, ensuring effective governance and regulatory compliance across member states.

metadata.category: 1006 EU institutions and European civil service
